title: How to Render Crony Capitalism Obsolete

cronyCap italismDefinition.mikeFraming: Crony capitalism and disinformation are two drivers of all bad things in the world: wars, Trump, repression of human rights country after country
cronyCap italismDefinition.jerryChallenge: Was there no crony capitalism under progressives? MAGA critique of left IS that it was crony capitalism
cronyCap italismDefinition.gilDistinction: Two different themes: capitalism and cronyism. Maybe add socialism to the mix.
cronyCap italismDefinition.mikeResponse: Crony socialism is a form of crony capitalism - follow the money. Socialism in air quotes. Marxism never got a chance.
cronyCap italismDefinition.alexInsight: Cronyism is independent of any political system. One's a political system (capitalism/socialism), one's a system of self-interest (cronyism).

russiaKleptocracy.siloviki: Putin's former FSB/KGB buddies who own privatized enterprises, scratch each other's backs
russiaKleptocracy.jerryObservation: 1.25M+ Russians dead in Ukraine conflict (Mike corrected: 250K dead, 1.2M casualties total) - astonishing Putin maintains power
russiaKleptocracy.whatToCallIt: Not communist anymore, not really capitalist, not democratic - kleptocracy? 'Weird mutt mix of stuff'
alexMobRule: When privatization happened, people didn't know what they were given
Mob rule: went to old people, said 'sign over or die'
Hundreds of thousands to millions extorted and killed
Lots of work being done on this now

copyrightIndustryCorruption.description: Mike Nelson's example of blatant crony capitalism
copyrightIndustryCorruption.lawrenceLessig: Fighting noble fight for years, lost Eldred vs Reno copyright case at Supreme Court - 'world would have been different'
copyrightIndustryCorruption.mikeInsight: Corruption caused by copyright industry drives the politics and policy
examples: Senators/congressmen promised million-dollar-a-year jobs running RIAA, Motion Picture Association
Invite almost every White House staffer to exclusive preview theater 5 blocks from White House
Blanket everyone so everybody thinks movie industry is most important industry in America
Not just focusing on policymakers - blanketing entire ecosystem

reputationalEconomy.description: John Kelly's proposed middle territory between economic and democratic systems
currentProblems: Economics world: transactions, measurement, gross ignoring of non-monetary values
Democracy world: people express intentions, should have consequences, very fragile
Reputational economies exist but problematic: social media followers, influencers
johnProposal: Everyone has influence (not just votes), some have more than others but BOUNDED
Cannot be taken down to zero influence
Cannot have more than some maximum amount
Earn social capital by contributing to community (not Chinese social credit way - no jaywalking penalties)
NOT in hands of government or corporation - quasi-public entity
Periodically fired at social problems (like civic assemblies)
Isolate issue, select people based on their earned influence

transparencyAsAntidote.description: Alex and Jerry on radical transparency
alexSolution: Power of cronyism is secrecy or delayed revelation
Force government and everyone: if you chat with government minister, produce document within HOURS
Recording, notes of what was spoken about - out in open within seconds
All money on blockchain - every penny traceable, anyone can question
Commercial confidentiality objection: 'crony capitalism has become such a problem that's irrelevant now'
Secret Service stuff objection: still need transparency
Impractical? Maybe. But these guys good at covering tracks under name of secrecy
transparencyAsAntidote.estoniaExample: When got country back, went all electronic. X-Road platform selling to other countries. Elected officials had to post calendars online.
transparencyAsAntidote.manhattanFailure: Andrew Roche and Mikha Sifry tried to run on open calendaring for elected officials in Manhattan - could not get it through
transparencyAsAntidote.clarenceThomasInsight: 'It's not the money that matters in the fancy jet, it's the conversations at those retreats. The conversations that matter, not the goodies.'

communityBelonging.description: Stacey's human part - small and local approach
condoStory: Changed rule: contractor living in building became VP, allowed to do work
Got family discount + showed contractor's discount on materials
Built trust, saved money, contractor got work in his own home
'Mental thing where we all belonged to the community'
communityBelonging.mondamiExample: 90,000 community members working together. People say 'theft!' Stacey: 'When you feel something belongs to you and your community, even if you steal, you usually steal from outside your community.'
communityBelonging.humanNature: Needs to be considered in system design

shamelessnessAndFakeNews.twoSectors: Only entertainment and finance repeatedly hear good people say: 'You gotta work with bad people if you're gonna make it in this business.' Always wants to throw up.
governmentChange: Used to be you didn't hear that in government
People afraid they'd be outed, held secrets over you
NOW: Secrets don't matter. There is no shame.
Don't have to worry being outed because it's 'fake news'
shamelessnessAndFakeNews.implication: Transparency still necessary but harder to leverage when shame mechanism broken

frameworksAndConcepts.name: Crony Capitalism vs Cronyism
frameworksAndConcepts.description: Cronyism is independent of political system - it's self-interest system, not political system

frameworksAndConcepts.name: Follow the Money
frameworksAndConcepts.description: Crony socialism is crony capitalism - it's all about the capital

frameworksAndConcepts.name: Bounded Influence
frameworksAndConcepts.description: Reputational economy where influence is earned but bounded - floor and ceiling

frameworksAndConcepts.name: Radical Transparency
frameworksAndConcepts.description: Every government conversation documented within hours/seconds, all money on blockchain

frameworksAndConcepts.name: Community Belonging as Anti-Corruption
frameworksAndConcepts.description: When people feel they belong, they're less likely to exploit - steal from outside, not inside

frameworksAndConcepts.name: Conversations Matter More Than Gifts
frameworksAndConcepts.description: Corruption is access and influence through conversations, not just money/goodies

questionsRaised: How to render crony capitalism obsolete?
Is cronyism independent of political systems?
How do we protect distributed ownership from being expropriated?
Can reputational economies work without becoming like Chinese social credit?
Is radical transparency practical or will secrecy always win?
How do we leverage transparency when shame is broken (fake news era)?
Who should run reputational economy system - not government, not corporation, but what?
Can community belonging scale beyond local?
What replaces accountability when 'nobody believes anything'?
specialNotes: Call explicitly about systemic corruption and potential solutions
Wide-ranging: Russia to copyright to condo associations
Three main solution approaches: reputational economies (John), transparency (Alex), community belonging (Stacey)
Tension: Mike and Jerry disagree on whether progressives had crony capitalism
Alex's Russia mob rule story: shocking scale (hundreds of thousands to millions killed)
Stacey's 'shamelessness' observation: transparency harder when shame mechanism broken
Jerry's insight: conversations matter more than gifts (Clarence Thomas)
Estonia as positive example of government transparency
Andrew Roche couldn't even get calendaring in Manhattan - shows difficulty
Stacey: Only entertainment and finance openly say 'work with bad people' - others hide it
emotionalTone: Frustrated with systemic corruption, searching for solutions, wrestling with practicality vs idealism
